Rule C.3 Between 01/07/2015 and 31/07/2015|url=http://www.thefa.com/-/media/files/thefaportal/governance-docs/registrations/july-2015.ashx|publisher=TheFA.com|accessdate=2 November 2017|page=45|format=pdf|date=27 November 2015}} | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1998|9|9|df=y}}{{cite web|title=Beni Baningime|url=http://www.evertonfc.com/players/b/bb/beni-baningime|publisher=Everton F.C.|accessdate=26 October 2017}} | birth_place = [[Kinshasa]], DR Congo | height = {{height|m=1.78}} | position = [[Midfielder#Central midfielder|Central midfielder]] | currentclub = [[Wigan Athletic F.C.|Wigan Athletic]] (on loan from [[Everton F.C.|Everton]]) https://www.wiganathletic.com/news/2019/january/the-first-thing-you-need-is-the-right-attitude-and-i-want-to-work-hard-and-give-my-best.---beni-baningime/ | clubnumber = | youthyears1 = 2007–2017 | youthclubs1 = [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] | years1 = 2017– | clubs1 = [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] | caps1 = 8 | goals1 = 0 | years2 = 2019– | clubs2 = → [[Wigan Athletic F.C.|Wigan Athletic]] (loan) | caps2 = 1 | goals2 = 0 | club-update = 07:33, 15 April 2018 (UTC) }} '''Beni Tangama Baningime''' (born 9 September 1998) is a Congolese-English{{cite web|url=http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuropaleague/season=2018/clubs/player=250116613/index.html|title=Beni Baningime|date=2 November 2017|publisher=UEFA}} professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[central midfielder]] for English club [[Wigan Athletic F.C.|Wigan Athletic]] on loan from [[Everton F.C|Everton]]. ==Career== Baningime joined Everton at the age of nine.{{cite web|url=http://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/who-beni-baningime-evertons-midfield-13812458|title=Meet Beni Baningime — the midfield prodigy likened to Kante|first=Adam|last=Jones|date=25 October 2017|publisher=}} He is an academy graduate of the club and won honours such as 'The Premier League 2'{{cite web|url=http://www.espn.co.uk/football/everton/story/3111722/everton-under-23s-win-premier-league-2-title?src=com|title=Everton U23s win Premier League 2 title|publisher=}} and the [[Dallas Cup]]{{cite web|url=http://www.evertonfc.com/news/2016/03/27/dallas-cup-final-report|title=So Close... - Everton Football Club|website=www.evertonfc.com}} during his time in the [[Everton F.C. Reserves and Academy]]. Baningime also won the [[Everton F.C. Reserves and Academy]] Player of the Year award for the 2016/17 season.{{cite web|url=http://www.evertonfc.com/news/2017/05/18/baningime-takes-top-academy-prize|title=So Close... - Everton Football Club|website=www.evertonfc.com}} Baningime's senior debut came in a [[EFL Cup|League Cup]] game against [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] in October 2017.{{Cite news|url=http://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/beni-baningime-shock-everton-debut-13812892|title=This is what David Unsworth thought of Baningime's debut|last=Doyle|first=Ian|date=2017-10-25|work=liverpoolecho|accessdate=2017-10-26}} Baningime made his [[Premier League]] debut as a half-time substitute against [[Leicester City F.C.|Leicester City]] on 29 October 2017.{{Cite web|url=https://www.footballfallout.com/premier-league-2017-2018/game/leicester-city-vs-everton-29-10-2017|title=Leicester City v Everton|website=Football Fallout|language=en-gb|accessdate=2017-11-03}}
In January 2019, he was loaned to [[Wigan Athletic F.C.|Wigan Athletic]] until the end of the season.{{cite web|url=https://www.wiganathletic.com/news/2019/january/wigan-athletic-sign-everton-midfielder-beni-baningime-on-loan-until-the-end-of-the-season/|title=WIGAN ATHLETIC SIGN EVERTON MIDFIELDER BENI BANINGIME ON LOAN UNTIL THE END OF THE SEASON|publisher=Wigan Athletic F.C.|date=31 January 2019|accessdate=7 February 2019}} ==Career statistics== ===Club=== {{updated|match played 14 April 2018}} {{cite web |url=https://int.soccerway.com/players/beni-baningime/453276/ |title=B. Baningime |website=Soccerway |publisher=Perform Group |accessdate=25 October 2017}} {| class=wikitable style="text-align: center;" |+ Appearances and goals by club, season and competition |- !rowspan=2|Club !rowspan=2|Season !colspan=3|League !colspan=2|FA Cup !colspan=2|League Cup !colspan=2|Other !colspan=2|Total |- !Division!!Apps!!Goals!!Apps!!Goals!!Apps!!Goals!!Apps!!Goals!!Apps!!Goals |- |rowspan=1|[[Everton F.C.|Everton]] |[[2017–18 Everton F.C. season|2017–18]] |[[Premier League]] |8||0||0||0||1||0||3{{efn|Appearance(s) in [[UEFA Europa League]]|name=UEL}}||0||11||0 |- !colspan=3|Career total !8!!0!!0!!0!!1!!0!!3!!0!!11!!0 |} {{notelist}} ==Personal life== Baningime has a brother named [[Divin Baningime]], who is a Congolese footballer for [[Wigan Athletic F.C.|Wigan Athletic.]].{{Cite web|url=https://www.wiganathletic.com/news/2017/october/find-out-more-about-latics-academy-graduate-involved-tonight-against-middlesbrough-u23/|title=Find Out More About Latics' Academy Graduates Involved Tonight Against Middlesbrough U21 |publisher=Wigan Athletic|date=24 October 2017|accessdate=8 November 2017 }} ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *{{soccerway|beni-baningime/453276}} {{Wigan Athletic F.C. squad}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Baningime, Beni}} [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:1998 births]] [[Category:Democratic Republic of the Congo footballers]] [[Category:Everton F.C. players]] [[Category:Wigan Athletic F.C. players]] [[Category:Association football midfielders]] [[Category:People from Kinshasa]] [[Category:English people of Democratic Republic of the Congo descent]] [[Category:Premier League players]] [[Category:English footballers]] {{DRCongo-footy-bio-stub}}
